title: Blood

avatar.name: Ka
avatar.tribe_status: Outsider by choice—sleeps alone near cave mouth, maintains distance from tribe pile

physical.description: Strong hunter's body, capable of solo kills
physical.notable_injuries: Arm torn by cat during attack, bound by tribe healer

psychology.core_belief_opening: Alone is strong. Together is weak. Ka thinks burning makes strong. Ka thinks alone safe.
psychology.core_flaw_manifestation: Proto-form of compulsive helper—the instinct is suppressed/undeveloped. Ka's arc moves TOWARD helping, not struggling with attachment to helping.
psychology.fatal_flaw: Hoarding—when given the choice between sharing and keeping, Ka reverts to isolation. Dies alone with hoarded meat.
psychology.the_ice_wall: Something in Ka's chest. Like ice wall. Like stone where heart should be. Heavy. Dead.
strengths: Ability to learn from watching others
Capacity for warmth when ice wall cracks
weaknesses: Isolation as default response to threat
psychology.recognition_marker_behavioral: The watching-to-understand quality—'Must learn their ways. Must understand new thing.' Persists into Silas's academic temperament.

tribe.status: Outsider by choice, then briefly integrated, then self-exiled
tribe.dynamic: Ka sleeps alone, maintains distance, but tribe saves Ka from cat

alpha_male.history: Past conflict—Ka remembers spear wound in side from fighting time, alpha male's teeth showing, others turning away
alpha_male.arc: From antagonist to unexpected source of acceptance (gives Ka new spear, respect-move at feast)

young_hunters.dynamic: Offer Ka food, make come-here movements, show fresh kill—rejected by Ka until tribe hunt

pack_hunters_dogs.role: Model of together-strength that Ka observes but initially rejects
pack_hunters_dogs.meaning: Represent what Ka must become but cannot sustain

opening_state.external: Ka sleeps alone near cave mouth while tribe sleeps in pile. Hunts alone. Strong but isolated.
opening_state.internal: Ice wall in chest. Believes alone is strong.

chapter_arc.catalyst: Observes pack hunters (dogs) killing with terrifying efficiency through cooperation
rising_action: Ka watches pack hunters, feels small and weak
Tribe saves Ka, binds wounds, gives new spear
Ka joins tribe hunt, experiences together-strength
regression: Sleeps near meat pile, guards it
Gives only small pieces when asked
Ka takes meat and walks into storm alone
chapter_arc.climax: Ka dies alone in cold, hoarded meat frozen solid

closing_state.external: Body dying in snow, meat useless
closing_state.internal: Finally understands giving—'Burning need to know giving'—but too late for this flesh

lesson_development.what_learned: That together is stronger than alone. That tribe-warmth exists and feels good. That cooperation enables survival.
lesson_development.what_failed: HOW to give—not just resources but self. Ka's final hoarding shows the lesson is intellectual desire, not embodied practice. The 'burning need to know giving' is hunger, not actualization.
lesson_development.death_insight: Finally learning give-way, too late for this flesh, but time stretches ahead... Ka's hunger to learn giving pushes through dark... Finds new place to grow, new flesh to learn through.
lesson_development.seeds_next_life: Ka dies with hunger to understand giving. Chandra (Ch 3) will have resources to give but will give resources, not self. The incomplete lesson evolves but remains incomplete.

death.circumstances: Self-exile into winter storm after refusing to share hoarded meat. Dies of cold, alone.
death.final_moments: Ka's secret meat now hard as rock. Like Ka's black fingers... Through cave-mouth, Ka sees smoke rise from tribe-cave below. Not one fire—many small fires join, make big warm.
death.thematic_resonance: The meat Ka hoarded becomes useless (frozen). The isolation Ka chose becomes death. Everything Ka learns comes too late for this body.
death.transcendence: Death takes Ka's meat but cannot take Ka's new hunger. Cannot take growing flame. Ka's next spirit burns toward new life like night-flutter flies to fire. Ready to learn. Ready to give.

ice_wall_chest_stone.arc: Appears → cracks when tribe saves Ka → melts during feast → returns when hoarding → final cold in death

the_pack_hunters.meaning: Together-strength that Ka must learn but initially fears
the_pack_hunters.description: Move like one big animal. Not wolf. Not bear. Not cat. Something new.

the_cat.meaning: Consequence of isolation—Ka alone is prey, not predator
the_cat.function: Crisis that forces Ka to accept tribe help

hoarded_meat.meaning: Attachment that kills—the frozen meat mirrors Ka's frozen heart
hoarded_meat.irony: What Ka keeps to survive is what ensures death

notes: This is the soul's earliest incarnation shown in the novel. The helper-instinct that becomes Silas's defining trait is here in embryonic form—not yet developed, not yet a fetter. Ka learns TO help (cooperation) but not HOW to give (true generosity). The regression/hoarding sequence shows that learning isn't linear—Ka achieves warmth and then loses it. This pattern of progress-then-regression may echo across incarnations.
